metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12086 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the 'BKE_mesh_calc_normals_tessface' functionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open a .blend file in order to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: blender package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
